text.tspan: Passed to a perl-Mojo template here
This acts as a shim between functions below
It can return data formatted in simple html to
Or it could return it as a JSON encoded string
These files can be split between a simple perl file
getting/saving the data and a separate
Mojo template .tpl file to display it
We could use say a 'panels' DB to control what
can be shown or not to give finer grained control
Potentially you could even drop a PHP file (Arrrgghh)
here to call the perl subroutines below
Sets of subroutines for variety of functions
at a higher level than the main DB commands in
Overarching SME commands inc CLI commands
Main interfaces to the configuration DBs
With this schema you can make two types of call. Either a direct call for a panel
Or you can make a call to a subroutine that will just return data
With the latter you will need no knowlege of perl. Or any knowledge really of SME
It is returned above as either
or as a JSON string of data
